==Chinese==
{{zh-forms}}

===Glyph origin===
{{Han etym}}
{{Han compound|甶|t1=spirit (abbreviated as 田)|爪|t2=claws, lower portion of [[虎]], tiger|ls=ic}} – a spirit/demon in shock/fear because of the claws (of a tiger).

From the ''[[w:Shuowen Jiezi|Shuowen]]'': “从甶，虎省。鬼頭而虎爪，可畏也。𤰲，古文省。” (“From 甶 and abridged [[虎]] [written as such in the [[w:Lesser Seal Script|Lesser Seal Script]]]. The head of a ghost encountering and frightened by the claws of a tiger. In the older script, [picture not shown, written with 甶 on top and 爪 below.]”)

[[胃]] has an identical pronunciation and also features 田 on the top, but isn't related accord to the ''Shuowen'', although it's used as the [[w:fanqie|fǎnqiè]] of 畏.
